players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the detective.
Night 1 begins.
Charlie was found dead.
You investigated Bob and discovered that they are the mafioso.
Day 1 begins.
You: "I have important information: Bob is the mafioso. We must vote to arrest him now to protect the town."
Diana: "Alice, your accusation is serious. Can you share why you believe Bob is the mafioso? We need solid reasons before voting to avoid mistakes."
Bob: "Alice, that's a very bold accusation to make so early. If you're the detective, you're painting a huge target on yourself. Diana is right - we need more than just accusations."
Diana: "Alice, if you are the detective and have evidence, please share what led you to accuse Bob. We need concrete proof to avoid lynching an innocent player."

Bob: "Diana, I appreciate your careful approach. Alice's immediate accusation without explanation is exactly what a mafioso might do to deflect suspicion. Think about it - why would a real detective expose themselves so recklessly on Day 1?"
You: "I understand your concerns, but I investigated Bob last night and my role as detective means I get accurate info. Charlie was killed, and Bob is the only mafia left. We can't risk waiting."
Votes: Alice voted for Bob, Bob voted for Alice, Diana voted for Bob
Bob was arrested
